page.title: 02ELSTON VILLAGE
page.content: {Elston}is a village with a population of about 660, 50 more than in the last census of 1983. Unlike{East Stoke,}it has several small estates of large modern houses which have been built in the last twenty years. This fairly extensive development has altered the character of the village, since many of the newcomers commute to the nearby towns of{Newark}and{Nottingham}for leisure as well as employment, and are therefore less involved in village life than the village-based population of the past. Few of the villagers work on the land, although there are still 5 workable farms associated with the village. {Elston's}amenities include two churches, a pub (Chequers Inn), a shop/P.O. and a primary school - not all of which are within this block, since parts of the village lie in the corners of the 3 adjacent blocks.
